title: Campus Health Center
author: California State University Monterey Bay
cleaned_text: [ Coronavirus Information ](/health/coronavirus-information/) CalOSHA COVID-19 Campus Requirements In compliance with [CalOSHA COVID-19 Prevention Non-emergency Regulation](/health/coronavirus-information/calosha-covid-19-campus-requirements/), CSUMB will continue to provide the following COVID-19 resources and services on campus through 2/3/2025. |Resource||Service||Campus Location| |COVID-19 Tests: Box of 40 Abbott Binax rapid tests||Free box - Pick up to self administer|| | The HUB, building 12, M - F, 9 am to 4 pm |COVID-19 Tests: Single Flowflex rapid test||Free single test - Pick up to self administer|| | Campus Health Center, building 80, M - F, 8 am to 5 pm |COVID-19 Testing: | Campus Health Center, building 80, M - F, 8 am to 5 pm 831-582-3965 [PCR](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/testing.html#types-of-tests)) [scheduler](https://mychart.svmh.com/dod/openscheduling?serviceAreas=31)(select COVID-19 Test). Must wear a mask to enter the CHC for service. Campus Health Center, building 80, M - F, 8 am to 5 pm 831-582-3965 [scheduler](https://mychart.svmh.com/dod/openscheduling?serviceAreas=31)(select Doses 1 or 2, Moderna or Pfizer). Fall 2023 COVID-19 Vaccine: Inquire regarding availability in October 2023, based on [FDA release](https://www.fda.gov/vaccines-blood-biologics/updated-covid-19-vaccines-use-united-states-beginning-fall-2023). Campus Health Center, building 80, M - F, 8 am to 5 pm 831-582-3965 Free masks, including 3-ply surgical and KN95 options, are available at: [Alumni Visitor Center](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Alumni+%26+Visitors+Center,+5108+4th+Ave,+Marina,+CA+93933/@36.654437,-121.801792,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca8d0ca348b:0x4369aab358bef167!8m2!3d36.6544369!4d-121.801792?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Info desk at main entrance [Building 12](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Student+Center/@36.654437,-121.801792,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca64e58172f:0xa59e1c58bdb5b5e5!8m2!3d36.6542839!4d-121.7973572?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Housing Office [Building 47](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Student+Veterans+Office+Bldg.+47/@36.6529587,-121.7994668,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfb5f475fd619:0xbc5ade43ed6bf2eb!8m2!3d36.6511904!4d-121.7931245?hl=en)| Student Service Center lobby [Library](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Tanimura+%26+Antle+Family+Memorial+Library/@36.6529587,-121.7994668,17z/data=!3m1!5s0x808dfca779926e5d:0xcd072c76f71003d0!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca779e99201:0x4afbb2360811470!8m2!3d36.6523326!4d-121.7961518?hl=en)| First floor [Otter Sports Center](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Otter+Sports+Center/@36.6544528,-121.8103626,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfcacf47f49d7:0x36403d301810ca1e!8m2!3d36.6544526!4d-121.8081741?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Info desk at main entrance [Otter Student Union](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Otter+Student+Union/@36.654437,-121.801792,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x4c3869ee74d7535a!8m2!3d36.6543993!4d-121.7960406?hl=en)| Info desk at main entrance [Promontory Housing Office](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Promontory/@36.657121,-121.8014576,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca5b3b00001:0xd061e47f3f237afb!8m2!3d36.6585145!4d-121.7963353?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Building B [University Center](https://www.google.com/maps/place/University+Center/@36.6529587,-121.7994668,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfb592a08b869:0x66fe47dc1d39ed1d!8m2!3d36.65003!4d-121.794197?hl=en&shorturl=1) - Mask-Friendly Campus Policy CSUMB is a mask-friendly campus policy. Anyone who chooses to wear a mask in most indoor spaces is welcome and encouraged to do so. [Read the policy announcement](https://csumb.edu/news/news-listing/masking-policy-message/). When and where masking is still required: - Face masks are required for patients with respiratory symptoms when accessing health care services at the Campus Health Center in Bldg 80. Masks are available. - Living in student housing and are symptomatic and awaiting test results and when COVID-19 positive and [fulfilling an isolation period](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Guidance-on-Isolation-and-Quarantine-for-COVID-19-Contact-Tracing.aspx) - Exposed to a COVID-19 positive person, are asymptomatic or symptomatic, and are awaiting test results - Any place where official signs indicate masking is required If you are a student who may need accommodations, email [Student Disability and Accessibility Center (SDAC)](mailto:sdac@csumb.edu)or call 831-582-3672. Availability of free masks: The university will continue to provide free masks, including 3-ply surgical and KN95 options, at these eight on campus locations: [Alumni Visitor Center](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Alumni+%26+Visitors+Center,+5108+4th+Ave,+Marina,+CA+93933/@36.654437,-121.801792,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca8d0ca348b:0x4369aab358bef167!8m2!3d36.6544369!4d-121.801792?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Info desk at main entrance [Building 12](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Student+Center/@36.654437,-121.801792,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca64e58172f:0xa59e1c58bdb5b5e5!8m2!3d36.6542839!4d-121.7973572?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Housing Office [Promontory Housing Office](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Promontory/@36.657121,-121.8014576,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfca5b3b00001:0xd061e47f3f237afb!8m2!3d36.6585145!4d-121.7963353?hl=en&shorturl=1)| Building B [University Center](https://www.google.com/maps/place/University+Center/@36.6529587,-121.7994668,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808dfb592a08b869:0x66fe47dc1d39ed1d!8m2!3d36.65003!4d-121.794197?hl=en&shorturl=1) - [For AY 2023-2024, employees and students are still required to complete the confidential and secure] [COVID-19 reporting form](https://csumb.tfaforms.net/30)if: - If you test at an off campus testing site and the test result is positive. - If you test off campus and your result is negative on a rapid test and you are waiting for the results of a PCR test. - Regardless of presently being on or off campus, if you are exposed to someone who is COVID-19 positive. - Anyone can submit the COVID-19 Positive Reporting Form for someone who is too ill to self-submit or have disclosed to you that they are positive and they have not submitted a report. Either inform the student or employee to submit a COVID-19 Reporting form or tell them you will do it for them. You will need to keep them on the phone until you complete the necessary information on the report. - - CSUMB Exposure Tracing consists of interviewing the positive case, documenting the campus locations where the case has been during their infectious period, and collecting the names of individuals who meet the definition of a close contact.CSUMB follows the California Department of Public Health's [isolation and close contact guidelines.](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Guidance-on-Isolation-and-Quarantine-for-COVID-19-Contact-Tracing.aspx)CDPH defines close contact as someone sharing the same indoor airspace, e.g., home, clinic waiting room, airplane etc., for a cumulative total of 15 minutes or more over a 24-hour period (for example, three individual 5-minute exposures for a total of 15 minutes) during an infected person's (laboratory-confirmed or a [clinical diagnosis](https://ndc.services.cdc.gov/case-definitions/coronavirus-disease-2019-2021/)) infectious period.Exposure locations are captured during the exposure tracing interview and are listed on the [Campus Locations Exposed to COVID-19](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/covid-19-data/). Anyone at that location can take extra precautions and follow the close contact guidelines. Actions that initiate Exposure Tracing - If an individual is tested at an off campus testing site and their test result is positive, they are to submit the [COVID-19 Positive Reporting Form](https://csumb.tfaforms.net/30). - If an individual, regardless of presently being on or off campus, is exposed to someone who is COVID-19 positive, they are to submit their own [COVID-19 Positive Reporting Form](https://csumb.tfaforms.net/30). - If an individual is waiting for the results of a PCR from an off campus location, they are to submit the [COVID-19 Positive Reporting Form](https://csumb.tfaforms.net/30). - Anyone can submit the [COVID-19 Positive Reporting Form](https://csumb.tfaforms.net/30)for someone who is too ill to self-submit or have disclosed to you that they are positive and they have not already submitted a report. Either inform the student or employee to submit a COVID-19 Reporting form or tell them you will do it for them. You will need to keep them on the phone until you complete the necessary information on the report. When a COVID-19 Positive Reporting form is submitted, an Exposure Tracing Analyst, and Human Resources or Corporation Human Resources will contact the positive student and/or employee. The Exposure Tracing Analyst will also contact the confirmed on campus close contacts. For details on Exposure Tracing, see the [CSUMB COVID-19 Prevention Plan](/media/csumb/covid-19-information/CSUMB-COVID19-Prevention-Plan_version_021723.pdf). - If an individual is tested at an off campus testing site and their test result is positive, they are to submit the - Effective April 6, 2023, per the revised California State University (CSU) [COVID-19 Vaccinations and Other Safety Measures policy](https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest/.), CSUMB students and employees are no longer required to register their COVID-19 vaccination status in the Otter Vaccination Registry. CSUMB students and employees are [required to continue to comply](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/calosha-covid-19-campus-requirements/)with all other related health and safety measures established by the campus, or federal/state laws and regulations. The updated [CalOSHA COVID-19 requirements](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/calosha-covid-19-campus-requirements/)also include the services that will continue to be available at CSUMB through 2/3/2025, such as vaccines, masks, [reporting of recent cases](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/covid-19-data/), etc. OVR Security - The Otter Vaccination Registry (OVR) form is now disabled. - The OVR data will be maintained as confidential medical records for three additional years, through February 3, 2026, to parallel the [CalOSHA COVID-19 Prevention Non-emergency Regulation](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/calosha-covid-19-campus-requirements/)requirement to maintain COVID-19 positive and exposure documentation one year after the [extension of contract tracing and other health measures through February 3, 2025](https://csumb.edu/health/coronavirus-information/calosha-covid-19-campus-requirements/). - CSUMB values openness and inclusion. The CSUMB community does not accept xenophobic behaviors expressed through speech, harassment, the spreading of misinformation, or misinformed decision-making. Anyone experiencing incidents of xenophobia or harassment may [report the incident](https://cm.maxient.com/reportingform.php?CSUMontereyBay&layout_id=0), and seek additional support from the [CSUMB Personal Growth & Counseling Center](/pgcc/coping-racism-discrimination/),
